title: Peeling Skin Syndrome: Diagnosis and Differential Diagnosis
short_description: Clinical guidance on diagnosing peeling skin syndrome and distinguishing it from similar skin conditions.
long_description: This document provides clinical information about peeling skin syndrome, focusing on diagnostic approaches including history, physical examination, and when necessary, tissue biopsy. It emphasizes the key distinguishing features that differentiate peeling skin syndrome from other similar conditions such as Netherton syndrome, autosomal recessive congenital ichthyosis, and collodion baby syndrome. The document highlights the characteristic continual shedding of large skin sheets and the recurring nature of symptoms as diagnostic markers.
